text: with the San Antonio Spurs and the Miami
Heat both repeating his conference
champions of finals encore awaits this
is the matchup that many NBA fans have
been hoping for and waiting for sports
columnist Harvey Ariton on the finals
rematch on the New York Times minute
this will be the Spurs sixth trip to the
NBA Finals for the Miami Heat it's trip
number five but they couldn't be more
different a miami heat brings star power
to the NBA Finals they have the best
player in the world in LeBron James and
another superstar in Dwyane Wade the
spurs on the other hand have a core of
players that while not flashy have
worked together for years it has been an
especially long year for quiet superstar
Tim Duncan now the 38 year old may be
looking for a capstone to a Hall of Fame
career for Tim Duncan this might be the
last opportunity for him to win a fifth
championship that eluded him last season
for the Miami sheet the big three is on
the verge of NBA history the prize 3p
which hasn't been done since the early
part of the 2000s when Kobe Bryant
Shaquille O'Neal and coach Phil Jackson
accomplished it in Los Angeles with the
Lakers but winner lose will the
triumvirate stay together all three have
opted out options in their contracts so
all or none could be testing the
free-agent waters this summer
